title: Raw string missing quote characters diagnostic does not mention missing quote characters

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
[Given the following code](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=f9d908ad9af77758b5988c03f0890dd3):
```rust
    let _data = br#
        [
	        {"name":"Lucy","age":18,"achievement":[95,86.5,90]},
	        {"name":"Lily","age":19,"achievement":[92.5,89,91]},
	        {"name":"Jack","age":20,"achievement":[93,90,93.5]}
        ]
    #;
```

The current output is:

```
error: found invalid character; only `#` is allowed in raw string delimitation: \n
 --> src/main.rs:2:17
  |
2 |       let _data = br#
  |  _________________^
3 | |         [
  | |_
```

However, the problem isn't that I wanted to use `br#\n" ... "\n#`, it's that I left out the `"`s completely.

I thought the confusion was perhaps because the raw string itself contained `"`, but [the same error results if there are no `"`](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=128726992adc063b84e3daaba7d5be71):
```
    let _data = br#[ zoinks ]#;
```

Ideally the output should suggest adding the `"` after/before the `r#`/ending `#`.  Alternatively it could at least mention the quote-requiring syntax.  (If this seems too implicitly obvious, note that [not every language](https://perldoc.perl.org/perlop#Quote-and-Quote-like-Operators) requires quotes.)

No change in output on Nightly or Beta.
